message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper focuses on the design of neuromorphic hardware for spiking neural networks, which is a topic related to artificial intelligence and neural networks. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the energy efficiency of the hardware, which is related to embedded systems, and the exploration of hardware architectures, which is related to computer architecture. Therefore, cs.ET (Embedded Systems), cs.AR (Architecture), and cs.SY (Systems and Control) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes modified versions of neural coding techniques, which is related to machine learning. Therefore, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a likely sub-category.
